nullify.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to officially state that something has no legal force
nullify.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The election results were nullified because of voter fraud.
nullify.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make something lose its effect or value
nullify.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Recent inflation could nullify the economic growth of the last several years.
nullify.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to state officially that something does not have any legal force and is therefore considered not to exist
nullify.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The Illinois Supreme Court reversed the decision of two lower courts and nullified the publisherâ€™s contract.
nullify.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make something lose its effect or value
nullify.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The surtax nullifies the benefit these taxpayers get from the lower, 15% tax rate.
